title: Wagyu beef and vegan burgers: where do you draw the line with cinema snacks?
text:
The tickets have been bought; the trailer committed to memory; the reviews eagerly read. You sit down, switch your phone off, and prepare yourself for two hours of cinematic bliss. But then – you hear the sound of a crisp packet being opened, a muffled ‘crunch crunch crunch’, and a “can you pass me the Coke?”. And for the next two hours, this is all you hear.

Eating in the cinema has long divided opinion, and this will only be exacerbated by the announcement Odeon will be opening a ‘Dine and Luxe’ cinema in London’s Islington Square. The cinema aims to go far further than troughs of popcorn and sweaty hot dogs; there, you will be able to chow down on Wagyu beef, flatbread pizzas, wild boar hot...
